page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: Farms in this area tend to be large and arable. The largest is Hall Farm, Ingrave. It covers 600 acres, of which 550 are{arable.}The crops grown are winter wheat, barley and oil seed rape. These are rotated annually. A subsidy for these crops is paid by the {E.E.C. }As well as its own combine harvester, the farm has seven tractors with various attachments. Only four men are{employed}on the farm. In recent years many of the fields have been enlarged by the removal of hedgerows. A few patches of woodland have been left. Most of the land is gently sloping and the clay soil requires underground drainage. the only livestock are 60 store bullocks, fattened on pasture. In the winter the wheat straw provides bedding and the barley straw feed, supplemented by hay and cattle cake.
